intro: Ribes klamathense, commonly known as Klamath gooseberry, is a shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, yellowish-green berries that ripen in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and mountainous areas. Due to its ornamental value and potential for hybridization, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
